briefdescription.para: Size of array in which to store record header info.
Vector of records in the file.

detaileddescription.para: The vector is initialized when the entire file is scanned to read out positions of each record in the file (in constructor).

briefdescription.para: Object for reading file.
File name.
File size in bytes.
File header.
Are we reading from file (true) or buffer?
Buffer being read.
Initial position of buffer.
Limit of buffer.
Keep one record for reading in data record-by-record.
Number or position of last record to be read.
First record's header.
Record number expected when reading.

detaileddescription.para: Used to check sequence of records.

briefdescription.para: If true, throw an exception if record numbers are out of sequence.
Object to handle event indexes in context of file and having to change records.
Files may have an xml format dictionary in the user header of the file header.
Each file of a set of split CODA files may have a "first" event common to all.
First event size in bytes.
Stores info of all the (top-level) events in a scanned buffer.
Is this object currently closed?
Is this data in file/buffer compressed?
Byte order of file/buffer being read.
Keep track of next EvioNode when calling getNextEventNode(), getEvent(uint32_t, uint32_t *), or getPrevEvent(uint32_t *).
If this buf/file contains non-evio events (permissible to read in this class), set this flag to false, which helps EvioCompactReader and EvioReader to avoid choking while trying to parse them.
If true, the last sequential call was to getNextEvent or getNextEventNode.

detaileddescription.para: If false, the last sequential call was to getPrevEvent. Used to determine which event is prev or next.

briefdescription.para: Evio version of file/buffer being read.
Set the byte order of the file/buffer being read.

parameterdescription.para: byte order of the file/buffer being read.

briefdescription.para: This method gets the total number of evio/hipo format bytes in the given buffer, both compressed and uncompressed.

detaileddescription.para: Results are stored in the given int array. First element is compressed length, second is uncompressed length.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer containing evio/hipo data

integer array containing evio/hipo data. Elements are:
compressed length in bytes (padded)
uncompressed length in bytes (padded)
number of elements in info array.

simplesect.para: total uncompressed hipo/evio data in bytes (padded).

parameterdescription.para: if not enough data in buffer.
null info arg or infoLen < 7.

briefdescription.para: This method gets the total number of evio/hipo format bytes in the given buffer, both compressed and uncompressed.

detaileddescription.para: Results are stored in the given int array. First element is compressed length, second is uncompressed length.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer containing evio/hipo data

integer array containing evio/hipo data. Elements are:
compressed length in bytes (padded)
uncompressed length in bytes (padded)
number of elements in info array.

simplesect.para: total uncompressed hipo/evio data in bytes (padded).

parameterdescription.para: if not enough data in buffer.
null info arg or infoLen < 7.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing. The open(std::string const &, bool) method has to be called to open the input stream. Also forceScanFile() needs to be called to find records.

briefdescription.para: Constructor with filename.

detaileddescription.para:
Creates instance and opens the input stream with given name. Uses existing indexes in file before scanning.
filename
input file name.
IOException
if error reading file
EvioException
if file is not in the proper format or earlier than version 6

briefdescription.para: Constructor with filename.

detaileddescription.para:
Creates instance and opens the input stream with given name.
filename
input file name.
forceScan
if true, force a scan of file, else use existing indexes first.
IOException
if error reading file
EvioException
if file is not in the proper format or earlier than version 6

briefdescription.para: Constructor for reading buffer with evio data.

detaileddescription.para: Buffer must be ready to read with position and limit set properly. If the given buffer contains compressed data, it is uncompressed into another buffer. The buffer containing the newly uncompressed data then becomes the internal buffer of this object. It can be obtained by calling getBuffer.

parameterdescription.para: buffer with evio data.
if true, check to see if all record numbers are in order, if not throw exception.
if buffer too small, not in the proper format, or earlier than version 6; if checkRecordNumSeq is true and records are out of sequence.

briefdescription.para: Opens an input stream in binary mode.

detaileddescription.para:
Scans for records in the file and stores record information in internal array. Each record can be read from the file.
filename
input file name
scan
if true, call scanFile(false).
EvioException
if error handling file

briefdescription.para: This closes the file.
Has close() been called (without reopening by calling setBuffer(std::shared_ptr<ByteBuffer> &))?

simplesect.para: true if this object closed, elsefalse .

briefdescription.para: Is a file being read?

simplesect.para: true if a file is being read,false if it's a buffer.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the file being read.

simplesect.para: name of the file being read or null if none.

briefdescription.para: Get the size of the file being read, in bytes.

simplesect.para: size of the file being read, in bytes, or 0 if none.

briefdescription.para: This method can be used to avoid creating additional Reader objects by reusing this one with another buffer.

detaileddescription.para: If the given buffer contains compressed data, it is uncompressed into another buffer. The buffer containing the newly uncompressed data then becomes the internal buffer of this object. It can be obtained by calling getBuffer.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer to be read
if not enough data in buffer.
if buf arg is null, not in the proper format, or earlier than version 6

briefdescription.para: Get the buffer being read, if any.

detaileddescription.para:
This may not be the buffer given in the constructor or in setBuffer if the original data was compressed. All data in the returned buffer is uncompressed.
buffer being read, if any.

briefdescription.para: Get the beginning position of the buffer being read.

simplesect.para: the beginning position of the buffer being read.

briefdescription.para: Get the file header from reading a file.

simplesect.para: file header from reading a file.

briefdescription.para: Get the first record header from reading a file/buffer.

simplesect.para: first record header from reading a file/buffer.

briefdescription.para: Get the byte order of the file/buffer being read.

simplesect.para: byte order of the file/buffer being read.

briefdescription.para: Get the Evio format version number of the file/buffer being read.

simplesect.para: Evio format version number of the file/buffer being read.

briefdescription.para: Is the data in the file/buffer compressed?

simplesect.para: true if data is compressed.

briefdescription.para: Does this file/buffer contain non-evio format events?

simplesect.para: true if all events are in evio format, else false.

briefdescription.para: Get the XML format dictionary if there is one.

simplesect.para: XML format dictionary, else null.

briefdescription.para: Does this evio file/buffer have an associated XML dictionary?

simplesect.para: true if this evio file/buffer has an associated XML dictionary, else false.

briefdescription.para: Get a byte array representing the first event.

parameterdescription.para: pointer filled with the size, in bytes, of the first event (0 if none). If null, this is ignored.

simplesect.para: byte array representing the first event. Null if none.

briefdescription.para: Get size, in bytes, of byte array representing the first event.

simplesect.para: size, in bytes, of byte array representing the first event. 0 if none.

briefdescription.para: Does this evio file/buffer have an associated first event?

simplesect.para: true if this evio file/buffer has an associated first event, else false.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of events in file/buffer.

simplesect.para: number of events in file/buffer.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of records read from the file/buffer.

simplesect.para: number of records read from the file/buffer.

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference to the list of record positions in the file.
Get a reference to the list of EvioNode objects contained in the buffer being read.

detaileddescription.para:
To be used internally to evio.
list of EvioNode objects contained in the buffer being read.

briefdescription.para: Get whether or not record numbers are enforced to be sequential.

simplesect.para: true if record numbers are enforced to be sequential.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of events remaining in the file/buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Useful only if doing a sequential read.

simplesect.para: number of events remaining in the file/buffer

briefdescription.para: Get a byte array representing the next event from the file/buffer while sequentially reading.

detaileddescription.para:
If the previous call was to getPrevEvent, this will get the event past what that returned. Once the last event is returned, this will return null.
len
pointer to int that gets filled with the returned event's len in bytes.
byte array representing the next event or null if there is none.
EvioException
if file/buffer not in hipo format

briefdescription.para: Get a byte array representing the previous event from the sequential queue.

detaileddescription.para:
If the previous call was to getNextEvent, this will get the event previous to what that returned. If this is called before getNextEvent, it will always return null. Once the first event is returned, this will return null.
len
pointer to int that gets filled with the returned event's len in bytes.
byte array representing the previous event or null if there is none.
EvioException
if the file/buffer is not in HIPO format

briefdescription.para: Get an EvioNode representing the next event from the buffer while sequentially reading.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this and calling getNextEvent() have the same effect in terms of advancing the same internal counter. If the previous call was to getPrevEvent, this will get the event past what that returned. Once the last event is returned, this will return null.

simplesect.para: EvioNode representing the next event or null if no more events, reading a file or data is compressed.

briefdescription.para: Reads user header of the file header/first record header of buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
The returned ByteBuffer also contains endianness of the file/buffer.
ByteBuffer containing the user header of the file/buffer.
IOException
if error reading file

briefdescription.para: Get a byte array representing the specified event from the file/buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
If index is out of bounds, null is returned.
index
index of specified event within the entire file/buffer, contiguous starting at 0.
len
pointer to int that gets filled with the returned event's len in bytes.
byte array representing the specified event or null if index is out of bounds.
EvioException
if file/buffer not in hipo format

briefdescription.para: Get a byte array representing the specified event from the file/buffer and place it in the given buf.

detaileddescription.para:
If no buf is given (arg is null), create a buffer internally and return it. If index is out of bounds, null is returned.
buf
buffer in which to place event data.
index
index of specified event within the entire file/buffer, contiguous starting at 0.
buf.
EvioException
if file/buffer not in hipo format, if buf has insufficient space to contain event (buf.capacity() < event size), or index too large.

briefdescription.para: Get a byte array representing the specified event from the file/buffer and place it in the given buf.

detaileddescription.para:
If no buf is given (arg is null), create a buffer internally and return it. If index is out of bounds, null is returned.
buf
buffer in which to place event data.
index
index of specified event within the entire file/buffer, contiguous starting at 0.
buf or null if buf is null.
EvioException
if file/buffer not in hipo format, if buf has insufficient space to contain event (buf.capacity() < event size), or index too large.

briefdescription.para: Returns the length of the event with given index.

parameterdescription.para: index of the event

simplesect.para: length of the data in bytes or zero if index does not correspond to a valid event.

briefdescription.para: Get an EvioNode representing the specified event from the buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
If index is out of bounds, nullptr is returned.
index
index of specified event within the entire buffer, starting at 0.
EvioNode representing the specified event or null if index is out of bounds, reading a file or data is compressed.
EvioException
index too large or reading from file.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the file has an event to read next.

simplesect.para: true if the next event is available, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Checks if the stream has previous event to be accessed through, getPrevEvent()

simplesect.para: true if previous event is accessible, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the number of events in current record.

simplesect.para: number of events in current record.

briefdescription.para: Get the index of the current record.

simplesect.para: index of the current record.

briefdescription.para: Get the current record stream.

simplesect.para: current record stream.

briefdescription.para: Reads record from the file/buffer at the given record index.

parameterdescription.para: record index (starting at 0).

simplesect.para: true if valid index and successful reading record, else false.

parameterdescription.para: if file/buffer not in hipo format

briefdescription.para: Extract dictionary and first event from file/buffer if possible, else do nothing.
Extract dictionary and first event from buffer if possible, else do nothing.
Extract dictionary and first event from file if possible, else do nothing.
This method scans a buffer to find all records and store their position, length, and event count.

detaileddescription.para: It also finds all events and creates & stores their associated EvioNode objects. The difficulty with doing this is that the buffer may contain compressed data. It must then be uncompressed into a different buffer.

simplesect.para: buffer containing uncompressed data. This buffer is different than the internal buffer. Ready to read.

parameterdescription.para: if buffer not in the proper format or earlier than version 6; if checkRecordNumberSequence is true and records are out of sequence.
if not enough data in buffer.

briefdescription.para: Scan buffer containing uncompressed data to find all records and store their position, length, and event count.

detaileddescription.para:
Also finds all events and creates & stores their associated EvioNode objects.
EvioException
if buffer too small, not in the proper format, or earlier than version 6; if checkRecordNumberSequence is true and records are out of sequence.

briefdescription.para: Scan file to find all records and store their position, length, and event count.

detaileddescription.para:
Safe to call this method successively.
IOException
if error reading file
EvioException
if file is not in the proper format or earlier than version 6; if checkRecordNumberSequence is true and records are out of sequence.

briefdescription.para: Scans the file to index all the record positions.

detaileddescription.para:
It takes advantage of any existing indexes in file.
force
if true, force a file scan even if header or trailer have index info.
IOException
if error reading file
EvioException
if file is not in the proper format or earlier than version 6

briefdescription.para: This method adds an evio container (bank, segment, or tag segment) as the last structure contained in an event.

detaileddescription.para: It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that the buffer argument contains valid evio data (only data representing the structure to be added - not in file format with record header and the like) which is compatible with the type of data stored in the given event.
To produce such evio data use EvioBank#write(ByteBuffer &), EvioSegment#write(ByteBuffer &) or EvioTagSegment#write(ByteBuffer &) depending on whether a bank, seg, or tagseg is being added.
The given buffer argument must be ready to read with its position and limit defining the limits of the data to copy.

parameterdescription.para: number of event to which addBuffer is to be added
buffer containing evio data to add (not evio file format, i.e. no record headers)

simplesect.para: a new ByteBuffer object which is created and filled with all the data including what was just added.

parameterdescription.para: if eventNumber out of bounds; if addBuffer arg is empty or has non-evio format; if addBuffer is opposite endian to current event buffer; if added data is not the proper length (i.e. multiple of 4 bytes); if the event number does not correspond to an existing event; if there is an internal programming error; if object closed

briefdescription.para: This method removes the data, represented by the given node, from the buffer.

detaileddescription.para: It also marks all nodes taken from that buffer as obsolete. They must not be used anymore.

parameterdescription.para: evio structure to remove from buffer

simplesect.para: ByteBuffer updated to reflect the node removal

parameterdescription.para: if object closed; if node was not found in any event; if internal programming error; if buffer has compressed data;

briefdescription.para: Print out all record position information.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::shared_ptr< ByteBuffer > &buf, uint32_t offset, uint32_t *info, uint32_t infoLen)
memberdef.name: findRecordInfo

briefdescription.para: Reads data from a record header in order to determine things like the bitInfo word, various lengths, etc.

detaileddescription.para: Does not change the position or limit of buffer.

parameterdescription.para: buffer containing evio header.
byte offset into buffer.

array in which to store header info. Elements are:
bit info word
record length in bytes (inclusive)
compression type
header length in bytes
index array length in bytes
user header length in bytes (no padding included)
uncompressed data length in bytes (no padding, w/o record header)
len in 32-bit words of array at info.
if not enough data in buffer.
null info arg or info.length < 7.

briefdescription.para: Reads data from a record header in order to determine things like the bitInfo word, various lengths, etc.

detaileddescription.para: Does not change the position or limit of buffer.

parameterdescription.para: buffer containing evio header.
byte offset into buffer.

array in which to store header info. Elements are:
bit info word
record length in bytes (inclusive)
compression type
header length in bytes
index array length in bytes
user header length in bytes (no padding included)
uncompressed data length in bytes (no padding, w/o record header)
len in 32-bit words of array at info.
if not enough data in buffer.
null info arg or info.length < 7.

briefdescription.para: Reader class that reads files stored in the HIPO format.

para.preformatted: Buffer or streamed data has this structure:
The important thing with a buffer or streaming is for the last header or trailer to set the "last record" bit.

detaileddescription.para: Something to keep in mind is one can intersperse sequential calls (getNextEvent, getPrevEvent, or getNextEventNode) with random access calls (getEvent or getEventNode), and the sequence remains unchanged after the random access.

simplesect.para: gavalian (original Java)
timmer
